intro: Meliosma robusta, commonly known as the robust mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of various host trees. It belongs to the family Loranthaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage. The plant has small, elliptical leaves that are typically arranged opposite each other on the stems. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers followed by fleshy, berry-like fruits. Meliosma robusta is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it plays a role in the ecological interactions of its host trees.
